revised_title: Upper Atmosphere Thermal Radiation and Absorption: Analyzing Equilibrium Temperatures
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
tldr: The authors analyze the thermal radiation and absorption in the upper atmosphere, calculating the rate of absorption of energy and the temperatures at which radiative equilibrium is attained. They consider the effects of solar radiation, water vapor, ozone, and molecular oxygen on the temperature and absorption rates, providing graphs and tables to help understand the complex interactions. This study supports the idea that the highest possible daytime equilibrium temperature in the upper atmosphere is around 3300K, and the actual temperature can vary depending on the concentrations of different gases.
